revisions.rev:
{{Infobox cricket tournament main | tournament name = Faysal Bank T20 Cup |county = Faysal Bank T20 | current = [[Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup 2011-12]] | image = | size = 150px | caption = Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup | country = {{Flagicon|Pakistan}} Pakistan | administrator = [[Pakistan Cricket Board]] | cricket format = [[Twenty20]] | first = [[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2004-05|2004-05]] ([[Faisalabad Wolves]]) | last = [[Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup 2011-12|2011-12]] ([[Sialkot Stallions]]) | tournament format = [[Round-robin tournament]] and [[Single-elimination tournament|Knockout]] | participants = [[#Franchises|14]] | champions = [[Sialkot Stallions]] (6th title) | qualification = | most successful = [[Sialkot Stallions]] (6 titles) | most runs = | most wickets = | website = }} The '''Twenty-20 Cup''' is a professional league for [[Twenty20]] [[cricket]] competition in [[Pakistan]], initiated in 2004 by the [[Pakistan Cricket Board]] (PCB), and is currently sponsored by [[Faysal bank|Faysal Bank]].[http://www.pcboard.com.pk/Pakistan/Articles/13/13193.html Faysal Bankâs new three-year Partnership with the PCB] The league currently consists of 13 teams, however is expected to be replaced next year with the new [[Pakistan Premier League T20|Pakistan Premier League]] ending a seven-year tenure of Pakistan's first domestic cricket competition. ==History== Beginning in 2004, the Twenty-20 Cup was sponsored by [[ABN AMRO]]. In 2008, it was renamed as the RBS Twenty20 Cup being sponsored by [[Royal Bank of Scotland]] (RBS). In 2010, Faysal Bank took over the sponsorship after RBS's contract expired. ===2004-05 season=== {{Main|ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2004-05}} The inaugural tournament was played in [[Lahore]] and was won by [[Faisalabad Wolves]].{{cite news|last=Sohail|first=Asif|title=Faisalabad Wolves win Pakistan's first ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup|url=http://www.pcboard.com.pk/Pakistan/Articles/2/2902.html|accessdate=2011-08-27|publisher=[[Pakistan Cricket Board]]|date=30 April 2005}} ===2005-06 season=== {{Main|ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2005-06}} The second edition of the tournament was played in [[Karachi]] and was won by [[Sialkot Stallions]], who defeated [[Faisalabad Wolves]] in the final by 6 wickets.{{cite web|title=Faisalabad Wolves v Sialkot Stallions|url=http://www.pcboard.com.pk/Pakistan/Scorecards/85/85245.html|publisher=[[Pakistan Cricket Board]]|accessdate=2011-08-27|date=4 March 2006}} ===2006-2007 season=== {{Main|ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2006-07}} The third edition of the tournament again took place in [[Karachi]]. [[Sialkot Stallions]] won for the second consecutive time defeating [[Karachi Dolphins]] in the final by 14 runs.{{cite web|title=Karachi Dolphins v Sialkot Stallions |url=http://www.pcboard.com.pk/Pakistan/Scorecards/109/109971.html| publisher=[[Pakistan Cricket Board]]| accessdate=2011-08-27| date=26 December 2006}} ===2007-08 season=== {{Main|RBS Twenty-20 Cup 2007-08}} The tournament's fourth edition was sponsored by the [[Royal Bank of Scotland]] and was played in [[Lahore]]. It was again won by [[Sialkot Stallions]] who defeated [[Karachi Dolphins]] in the final by 7 wickets.{{cite web|title=Karachi Dolphins v Sialkot Stallions|url=http://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/187/187921.html|publisher= [[Cricket Archive]]| accessdate=2011-08-27| date=8 October 2008}} ===2008-09 season=== {{Main|RBS Twenty-20 Cup 2008-09}} The fifth edition of the tournament was again played in Lahore and was won by [[Sialkot Stallions]] who completed their fourth consecutive triumph in the tournament. The stallions defeated the [[Lahore Lions]] in the final by 4 wickets.{{cite web|title=Abbas and Nazir help Sialkot retain title|url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/pakdomestic/content/story/406585.html|publisher=[[Cricinfo]]|accessdate=2011-08-27|date=28 May 2009}} ===2009-10 season=== {{Main|2009â10 RBS Twenty-20 Cup}} The tournament's sixth edition, sponsored by [[Royal Bank of Scotland|RBS]] was held from 28 February to 7 March 2010 in [[National Stadium, Karachi|National Stadium]], [[Karachi]]. [[Sialkot Stallions]] successfully defended the title and won the tournament for the fifth consecutive time, defeating [[Faisalabad Wolves]] in the final by 5 wickets. ===2010-11 season=== {{Main|2010â11 Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup}} The seventh edition of the tournament was sponsored by Faysal Bank. The [[Karachi Dolphins]] led by [[Shahid Afridi]] and the [[Lahore Lions]] captained by [[Mohammad Yousuf]] competed in the final, which the Lahore Lions won by 37 runs. ===2011 Season=== {{Main|Faysal Bank Super 8 T20 Cup 2011}} The eighth edition of the tournament was played from 24 June to 1 July 2011 in [[Iqbal Stadium]], [[Faisalabad]]. This edition only included the top eight teams from the last edition. [[Rawalpindi Rams]] won the tournament for the first time defeating Karachi Dolphins in the final by 9 runs through [[Super Over]] eliminator. ===2011-12 Season=== {{Main|Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup 2011-12}} The ninth edition of the tournament will be the calendar's full version with all 11 regions (and 13 teams as Karachi and Lahore have two teams) involved, unlike the previous edition which involved just the top eight sides of the country. And a team [[Afghan Cheetahs]] from [[Afghanistan national cricket team|Afghanistan]] will also participate in the tournament. Sialkot Stallions wins Faysal Bank Twenty20 Cup sixth time in 2011/12. ==League== ===Teams=== At the current moment the following thirteen teams make up the Twenty-20 Cup. They are shuffled into one group of 4 and three groups of 3 every year. {{Location map+|Pakistan|width=400|float=center |caption=Twenty-20 Cup Franchises |AlternativeMap= |places= {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Abbottabad Falcons|Falcons]]|position=right|lat=34.09|long=73.13}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Peshawar Panthers|Panthers]]|position=left|lat=34.01|long=71.35}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Afghan Cheetahs|Cheetahs]]|position=left|lat=34.05|long=67.13}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Islamabad Leopards|Leopards]]|position=right|lat=33.43|long=73.04}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Rawalpindi Rams|Rams]]|position=left|lat=33.120|long=73.020}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Sialkot Stallions|Stallions]]|position=left|lat=32.2950|long=74.3210}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Lahore Eagles|Eagles]]|position=left|lat=31.32|long=74.2037}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Lahore Lions|Lions]]|position=right|lat=31.00|long=74.2037}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Faisalabad Wolves|Wolves]]|position=left|lat=30.90|long=72.5940}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Multan Tigers|Tigers]]|position=right|lat=30.120|long=71.250}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Quetta Bears|Bears]]|position=right|lat=30.1238|long=67.18}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Hyderabad Hawks|Hawks]]|position=right|lat=25.2245|long=68.2206}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Karachi Dolphins|Dolphins]]|position=left|lat=24.74|long=67.036}} {{Location map~|Pakistan|label=[[Karachi Zebras|Zebras]]|position=right|lat=24.513|long=67.250}}}} {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:98%;" |- ! style="width:20%;"|'''Team''' ! style="width:10%;"|'''City''' ! style="width:5%;"|'''Founded''' ! style="width:15%;"|'''Owner''' ! style="width:15%;"|'''Captain''' |- | [[Karachi Dolphins]]

style="width:25%;"| Winners ! style="width:25%;"| Runners-up ! style="width:40%;"| Venue |- |[[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2004-05|2004-05]] |[[Faisalabad Wolves]] |[[Karachi Dolphins]] |[[Gaddafi Stadium]], [[Lahore]] |- |[[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2005-06|2005-06]] |[[Sialkot Stallions]] |[[Faisalabad Wolves]] |[[National Stadium]], [[Karachi]] |- |[[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2006-07|2006-07]] |[[Sialkot Stallions]] |[[Karachi Dolphins]] |[[National Stadium]], [[Karachi]] |- |[[RBS Twenty-20 Cup 2007-08|2007-08]] |[[Sialkot Stallions]] |[[Karachi Dolphins]] |[[National Stadium]], [[Karachi]] |- |[[RBS Twenty-20 Cup 2008-09|2008-09]] |[[Sialkot Stallions]] |[[Lahore Lions]] |[[Gaddafi Stadium]], [[Lahore]] |- |[[2009â10 RBS Twenty-20 Cup|2009-10]] |[[Sialkot Stallions]] |[[Faisalabad Wolves]] |[[National Stadium]], [[Karachi]] |- |[[2010â11 Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup|2010-11]] | [[Lahore Lions]] | [[Karachi Dolphins]] |[[Gaddafi Stadium]], [[Lahore]] |- |[[Faysal Bank Super 8 T20 Cup 2011|2011]] | [[Rawalpindi Rams]] | [[Karachi Dolphins]] |[[Iqbal Stadium]], [[Faisalabad]] |- |[[Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup 2011-12|2011-12]] | [[Sialkot Stallions]] | [[Rawalpindi Rams]] |[[National Stadium]], [[Karachi]] |} ==Media coverage== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |+ ! style="width:8%;"| Season ! style="width:12%;"| Official Broadcaster ! style="width:35%;"| Regional Broadcast Rights ! style="width:10%;"| Host |- |[[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2004-05|2004-05]] |[[Ten Sports]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]], {{flagicon|India}}[[India]], {{flagicon|Sri Lanka}}[[Sri Lanka]], {{flagicon|Bangladesh}}[[Bangladesh]], {{flagicon|Nepal}}[[Nepal]], {{flagicon|Hong Kong}}[[Hong Kong]], {{flagicon|Singapore}}[[Singapore]], {{flagicon|Indonesia}}[[Indonesia]] |[[Lahore]] |- |[[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2005-06|2005-06]] |[[Ten Sports]]'''#1''' |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]], {{flagicon|India}}[[India]], {{flagicon|Sri Lanka}}[[Sri Lanka]], {{flagicon|Bangladesh}}[[Bangladesh]], {{flagicon|Nepal}}[[Nepal]], {{flagicon|Hong Kong}}[[Hong Kong]], {{flagicon|Singapore}}[[Singapore]], {{flagicon|Indonesia}}[[Indonesia]] |[[Karachi]] |- | |[[PTV Home|PTV 1]]'''#2''' |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Karachi]] |- |[[ABN-AMRO Twenty-20 Cup 2006-07|2006-07]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Karachi]] |- |[[RBS Twenty-20 Cup 2007-08|2007-08]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Karachi]] |- |[[RBS Twenty-20 Cup 2008-09|2008-09]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Lahore]] |- |[[2009â10 RBS Twenty-20 Cup|2009-10]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Karachi]] |- |[[2010â11 Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup|2010-11]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Lahore]] |- |[[Faysal Bank Super 8 T20 Cup 2011|2011]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Faisalabad]] |- |[[Faysal Bank Twenty-20 Cup 2011-12|2011-12]] |[[Geo Super]] |{{flagicon|Pakistan}}[[Pakistan]] |[[Karachi]] |} '''#1''' [[Ten Sports]] was covering the tournament,but after a bomb blast in [[Karachi]] [[Ten Sports]]'s broadcasting team went back from [[Pakistan]].
'''#2''' [[PTV Home|PTV 1]] covered the some matches of the remaining tournament,after [[Ten Sports]]'s team went back from [[Pakistan]] because of a bomb blast in [[Karachi]]. ==See also== {{Portal|cricket}} * [[List of domestic Twenty20 cricket competitions]] * [[Yeh Hai Cricket Pakistan]] * [http://www.facebook.com/pages/Yeh-Hai-Cricket-Pakistan/282511231767880 Yeh Hai Cricket Pakistan - Facebook Page] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Pakistan Twenty20 League}} {{Twenty20 leagues}} [[Category:Twenty-20 Cup| ]] [[Category:Twenty20 cricket leagues]] [[Category:Pakistani domestic cricket competitions]] [[Category:Professional sports leagues]] [[Category:2004 establishments]] [[Category:Sports leagues in Pakistan|Cricket]]
